Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Amulets in the likeness of goddess Taweret
Description: Four amulet fragments depicting in all likelihood the hippopotamus goddess Taweret.(1) two fragments corresponding to the lower section of the body, very stylised. The amulets have been pierced through their height.(2) a fragment corresponding to the upper section of the body (head of a hippopotamus and upper section of the chest), pierced through its height.(3) fragment corresponding to the upper section (head of a hippopotamus wearing a wig and a hand resting on a prominent belly) with a double clasp at the top.
